_prev_prog_3.EquipmentTested: Protection Systems (Power Units, Detectors, Extinguishers) and Explosion Protection Systems

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
This is an executive summary of the policies, procedures and activities for compliance with the EPA's Accidental Release Prevention Requirements - Risk Management Program pursuant to 40 CFR 68 for Fruit of the Earth's (FOTE) Trinity West manufacturing facility.

The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the stationary source [40 CFR 68.155(a)]:
The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies are addressed in the individual RMP/PSM procedures, which detail the RMP / PSM program requirements as well as how FOTE will comply with the applicable requirements.  The site is not a responding facility for releases of the RMP listed chemicals, so the site utilizes an Emergency Action Plan.  FOTE Senior Management are committed to the implementation of the RMP/PSM procedures.

The stationary source and regulated substances handled [40 CFR 68.155(b)]:
The FOTE facility manufactures personal care products and has added an aerosol storage and an aerosol injection system at its Trinity West facility in Fort Worth, Texas.  The Trinity West facility has one covered process that includes unloading, storage and handling of the three listed aerosol propellants.  The RMP / PSM covered process boundary at FOTE Trinity West includes the propellant unloading, storage and gashouse operations.  Trucks bring the propellants onsite to unload each of the chemicals into its appropriate tank(s).  There are three propellant tanks, each with a design capacity of 6,565 gallons but limited to 85% of maximum tank capacity. The covered process boundary ends after the filling operations in the gashouse.  

FOTE has reviewed plant storage and usage data and determined that three propellants onsite are listed RMP flammable chemicals.  The RMP threshold quantity is 10,000 pounds for flammable mixtures containing greater than one (1) percent by weight of a listed flammable component with a mixture National Fire Protection Association (NFPA) flammability r

ating of 4. The RMP-listed flammable chemicals that are present at the FOTE Trinity West facility include:

 	n-Butane 
 	Isobutane
 	1,1-Difluoroethane 

The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps [40 CFR 68.155(c)]:
The FOTE Trinity West Facility has implemented the Program Level 3 prevention program requirements under the RMP regulations.  The facility is also subject to the PSM regulations under the general flammable category. The required elements of the RMP prevention program are listed below:

 	Employee Participation
 	Process Safety Information
 	Process Hazard Analysis
 	Operating Procedures
 	Contractors
 	Pre-startup Safety Review
 	Mechanical Integrity
 	Hot Work Permit
 	Management of Change
 	Incident Investigation
 	Emergency Planning and Response
 	Compliance Audits

These items, their specific requirements, and how the FOTE Trinity West facility will comply with the requirements are addressed in the individual procedural documents.

The five-year accident history [40 CFR 68.155(d)]:
The FOTE Trinity West facility has had zero (0) RMP reportable incidents in the previous five years.

The emergency response program [40 CFR 68.155(e)]:
FOTE is a non-responding facility with respect to the RMP-covered process chemicals. In the event of an emergency, FOTE will notify the local fire departments to respond and will evacuate their employees when needed.  Additional details related to emergency procedures can be located in the facility's Emergency Action Plan. 

Planned changes to improve safety [40 CFR 68.155(f)]:
The facility completed a process hazard analysis (PHA) on June 16, 2016, which identified several recommendations for enhanced process safety.  These recommendations are summarized in the PHA report and are currently under evaluation.
